Comment: A unique ID number for the Purchase Order.
The status of the Purchase Order. Will be one of:0 = Not Processed1 = Partly Processed2 = Fully Processed3 = Quotation4 = Awaiting Authorisation
The ID number of the Creditor account that the Purchase Order was created for.
The date and time when the Purchase Order was created.
The date and time when the Purchase Order is due.
An additional reference code for the Purchase Order.
Delivery address line 1.
Delivery address line 2.
Delivery address line 3.
Delivery address line 4.
This field is set via the On-Demand Purchase Orders function of the EXO Distribution Advantage module.
The subtotal amount on the Purchase Order.
The total tax amount on the Purchase Order.
The ID number of the staff member assigned to the Purchase Order.
The ID number of the Contact assigned to the Purchase Order.
The ID number of the currency that the Purchase Order is in.
The exchange rate for the currency that the Purchase Order is in.
Set to 'Y' if the Purchase Order is tax-inclusive.
The date and time when the Purchase Order was last updated.
The Branch number on the Purchase Order.
The ID number of the staff member who authorised the Purchase Order.
The date and time when the Purchase Order was authorised.
The total amount for the Sales Order.
If this field is set to 'Y', this means that all lines in the Purchase Order have been confirmed, i.e. the supplier/creditor has acknowledged the order.
Specifies which of the Lead Times defined for the Creditor the Purchase Order uses. Will be one of:0 = Primary Lead Time1 = Secondary Lead Time
Delivery address line 5.
Delivery address line 6.
The ID number of the narrative attached to the Sales Order header.
For On-Demand Purchase orders, this field contains the line status. Comes from the profile setting 'B2B new purchase line status'.
The default location that stock is being supplied from.
Will be one of:0 = Normal1 = Deleted2 = Forced Fully Processed
The Transaction ID assigned to the Purchase Order - this applies when using a payment gateway.
If the Purchase Order was generated from a Sales Order, the Sales Order's ID number is recorded here.
The date and time when the Purchase Order was created.
The date and time when the Purchase Order was activated.
The date and time when the Purchase Order was finalised.
The value of the Purchase Order in the local currency.
If the Purchase Order is associated with a campaign wave (EXO CRM), its ID number is recorded here.
